chapters.title: Knowing Our Numbers

concepts.title: Place Value System
concepts.explanation: Understanding ones, tens, hundreds, thousands, lakhs, crores
concepts.visualAid: Place value chart with Indian number system
examples: Which is greater: 5 lakhs or 50 thousands?
practice: Write the greatest 6-digit number using digits 0-9

concepts.title: Reading and Writing Large Numbers
concepts.explanation: How to read numbers in Indian and International system
concepts.visualAid: Comparison chart: Indian vs International number system

concepts.title: Estimation and Rounding
concepts.explanation: Rounding to nearest 10, 100, 1000 for quick calculations
concepts.aiTip: I'll show you the 'midpoint rule': if digit is 5 or more, round up!

concepts.title: Using Brackets in Calculations
concepts.explanation: BODMAS/PEMDAS rule for order of operations
concepts.visualAid: BODMAS pyramid: Brackets → Orders → Division/Multiplication → Addition/Subtraction
concepts.commonMistakes: Students often solve left to right. Remember: Multiply/Divide before Add/Subtract!

concepts.title: Reading Roman Numerals
concepts.visualAid: Roman numeral chart with symbols and values
concepts.memoryTrick: I Value Xylophones Lightly, Cows Don't Moo
concepts.realLifeExample: Clock faces, Super Bowl numbers, movie credits
practice: Convert to numbers: XLII, CDXC, MMXXIV

learningOutcomes: Compare and order numbers up to 10 crores
Read and write Roman numerals up to 1000

assessmentQuestions.question: What is the place value of 7 in 87,65,432?
assessmentQuestions.aiHint: Count the positions from right: ones, tens, hundreds, thousands, ten thousands, lakhs, ten lakhs...

assessmentQuestions.question: A city has 45,67,890 people. Round this to the nearest lakh.
assessmentQuestions.aiHint: Look at the ten thousands place (6). Is it 5 or more? Then round up!

chapters.title: Whole Numbers

concepts.title: Representing Numbers on Number Line
concepts.explanation: Visual representation of numbers showing order and distance
concepts.aiActivity: I'll draw a number line and you tell me which number I'm pointing to!

concepts.title: Predecessor and Successor
concepts.explanation: Number that comes before (predecessor) and after (successor)
concepts.funFact: Every whole number has a successor, but 0 has no predecessor in whole numbers!

concepts.title: Commutative Property
concepts.explanation: Order doesn't matter in addition and multiplication
concepts.aiQuestion: Does this work for subtraction? Try: 5 - 3 vs 3 - 5. What do you notice?

concepts.title: Associative Property
concepts.explanation: Grouping doesn't matter in addition and multiplication

concepts.title: Distributive Property
concepts.aiTrick: Use this property to multiply large numbers mentally!

learningOutcomes: Understand and apply properties of whole numbers
realWorldConnections: Shopping: Using distributive property for quick bill calculation
Sports: Understanding scores and rankings using number line
Patterns: Recognizing patterns in nature, art, and daily life

chapters.title: Playing with Numbers

concepts.title: Understanding Factors
concepts.explanation: Numbers that divide exactly into another number
examples: Find all factors of 24 using pairs: (1,24), (2,12), (3,8), (4,6)
concepts.aiMethod: I'll teach you the 'pair method' - start with 1 and the number, then find pairs!
practice: Which numbers have exactly 2 factors? (Prime numbers!)

concepts.title: Understanding Multiples
concepts.explanation: Numbers you get when you multiply by whole numbers

concepts.title: Prime Numbers
concepts.explanation: Numbers with exactly 2 factors: 1 and itself
examples: Why is 2 the only even prime? All other evens are divisible by 2!
concepts.memoryTrick: Remember: 1 is NOT prime (it has only 1 factor, not 2)
concepts.aiGame: Prime number detective - I'll give you a number, you tell me if it's prime!

concepts.title: Composite Numbers
examples: Every composite can be written as product of primes: 12 = 2 × 2 × 3

concepts.title: Prime Factorization
concepts.explanation: Breaking a number into prime factors
concepts.aiMethod: Division method: Keep dividing by smallest prime until you get 1

concepts.title: Highest Common Factor (HCF)
concepts.explanation: Largest number that divides all given numbers

methods.name: Listing Method
methods.example: HCF of 12 and 18: Factors of 12: 1,2,3,4,6,12; Factors of 18: 1,2,3,6,9,18; Common: 1,2,3,6; HCF = 6

methods.name: Prime Factorization
methods.example: 12 = 2² × 3, 18 = 2 × 3²; HCF = 2 × 3 = 6 (take lowest power of common primes)

concepts.realLifeUse: Cutting ribbons of 12cm and 18cm into equal largest pieces → 6cm each

concepts.title: Lowest Common Multiple (LCM)
concepts.explanation: Smallest number that is a multiple of all given numbers

methods.name: Listing Method
methods.example: LCM of 4 and 6: Multiples of 4: 4,8,12,16,20,24...; Multiples of 6: 6,12,18,24...; LCM = 12

methods.name: Prime Factorization
methods.example: 4 = 2², 6 = 2 × 3; LCM = 2² × 3 = 12 (take highest power of all primes)

concepts.realLifeUse: Two bells ring every 4 and 6 minutes. When will they ring together? After 12 minutes!
concepts.aiTip: HCF is always ≤ smallest number, LCM is always ≥ largest number

concepts.title: Divisibility Rules
concepts.explanation: Quick tricks to check if a number is divisible without actual division

rules.rule: Sum of digits is divisible by 3
Difference of sum of alternate digits is 0 or divisible by 11

concepts.aiGame: I'll give you a number, you tell me which numbers divide it using rules!
practice: Find a 3-digit number divisible by 2, 3, and 5

learningOutcomes: Find factors and multiples of numbers
Calculate HCF and LCM using multiple methods
Apply divisibility rules for quick calculations
chapters.parentTip: This chapter builds number sense - crucial for algebra later. Practice divisibility rules daily!

assessmentQuestions.question: Three bells ring at intervals of 4, 6, and 8 minutes. If they ring together at 6:00 AM, when will they ring together again?
assessmentQuestions.solution: Find LCM of 4, 6, 8 = 24 minutes. They ring together at 6:24 AM
assessmentQuestions.aiHint: This is an LCM problem! Find when all three cycles complete together.
